message_2:
To simplify the rational expression, we first factor out the common terms in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator: (4x^2 + 12x)
Factor out the common term 4x:
4x(x + 3)

Denominator: (8x^3 - 24x^2)
Factor out the common term 8x^2:
8x^2(x - 3)

Now, the rational expression is:
(4x(x + 3)) / (8x^2(x - 3))

We can simplify this expression by canceling out the common factors:

(4x(x + 3)) / (8x^2(x - 3))

Divide both the numerator and the denominator by 4x:

(4x/4x)((x + 3)) / ((8x^2/4x)(x - 3))

This simplifies to:

(x + 3) / (2x(x - 3))

So, the simplified rational expression is:

(x + 3) / (2x(x - 3))
